intro: Connarus cymosus var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved connarus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
